alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Elk; Potter (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 9:48AM EST until February 19 at 10:15AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN ELK...SOUTHEASTERN POTTER AND CAMERON COUNTIES... At 948 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Woodhull to St. Marys, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from east of Coudersport to Galeton. Route 219 from Brockport to Brockport. State Road 120 from east of St. Marys to east of Driftwood. State Road 255 from north of Penfield to south of St. Marys. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Emporium, Cameron, Wharton, Galeton, Force, Benezette, Cross Fork, Harrison Valley, Hicks Run, Denton Hill State Park, Medix Run, Ole Bull State Park, Lyman Run State Park, Stevenson Dam, Cherry Springs State Park, Brockport, Truman, Sizerville and Kersey. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
